zeropad.m

00001 %%
00002 %! @file
00003 % Expand the matrix to power of 2 before doing FFT.
00004 %
00005 
00006 %%
00007 %! Zeropad each column to preprare for FFT. Expand the length of each column to the power of 2. The value of s in each row is also computed.
00008 % @param Radon matrix of Radon image
00009 % @retval Radon2 expaned matrix of Radon image
00010 % @retval axis_s value of s in each row
00011 function [Radon2 axis_s] = zeropad(Radon)
00012 
00013 [size_s size_theta] = size(Radon)
00014 next_power_of_2 = pow2(nextpow2(size_s));
00015 
00016 % Shift the DC to the left
00017 shifted_Radon = ifftshift(Radon,1);
00018 
00019 % Estimate the size of zeropad required
00020 size_zeropad = next_power_of_2 - size_s;
00021 zeropad = zeros(size_zeropad,size_theta);
00022 
00023 if(size_s & 2) % if length is an odd number, the 'middle' is between (size_s + 1)/2 and (size_s + 1)/2+1
00024         mid_position = (size_s + 1)/2;
00025 else    % if length is an even number, the 'middle' is between size_s/2 and size_s/2+1
00026         mid_position = size_s / 2;
00027 end
00028 
00029 % Add zeros to the middle of the shifted signal
00030 shifted_Radon2 = vertcat(shifted_Radon(1:mid_position,:),zeropad,shifted_Radon((mid_position+1):size_s,:));
00031 
00032 % Shift the DC back to the centre
00033 Radon2 = fftshift(shifted_Radon2,1);
00034 
00035 % label the new s axis
00036 axis_s = linspace(-next_power_of_2/2,next_power_of_2/2,next_power_of_2);
00037
